	Must be between 22 and 27 years
	Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Previous experience in customer service or sales roles is a plus, but is not a must as long as you have a can-do attitude.

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application letter to:&nbsp;nifemioluwadamilare@printplace.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	PrintplaceNG is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

Customer Service Sales Representative Job at PrintplaceNG




        
    

        
        PrintplaceNG is Nigeria's premier digital printing and brand solutions company, based in Lagos, serving clients nationwide and across Africa. Founded by two visionary engineering graduates, we've evolved into an innovative brand merchandising company employing a dynamic team of over 12 creative professionals.

Our services span brand design, corporate events, merch branding, packaging design, and product launches, catering to over 200 brands. We combine strategic thinking with bold creative execution to help businesses position their brands effectively in a competitive marketplace.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Sales Representative
     

            
    



Job Location: Mushin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	This is a full-time, on-site role for a Customer Service Sales Representative located in Lagos. The representative will be responsible for managing customer inquiries, providing excellent customer service, processing orders, and maintaining customer accounts.
	They will also be tasked with upselling and cross-selling products, addressing customer complaints, and working closely with other departments to ensure customer satisfaction.


Qualifications


	A minimum of an OND in Business, Marketing, or a related field
	Applicants must live within Idi Araba, Mushin, Oshodi, Itire, Surulere, Cele, Onipanu and Ilasamaja axis
	Strong communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills
	Must be between 22 and 27 years
	Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Previous experience in customer service or sales roles is a plus, but is not a must as long as you have a can-do attitude.


Salary
N80,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application letter to: nifemioluwadamilare@printplace.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	If you think all this sounds like you, then hop in and show us what you can do!
	PrintplaceNG is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

	Manage day-to-day financial transactions, reconciliations, and bookkeeping.

  "description": "Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa&#39;s financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Banker, Business

Job Ref ID:80438460A-0001
Job Location:&nbsp;Ota, Sango Over Bridge, Ogun
Employment Type: Full Time
Business Segment: Business &amp; Commercial Banking.

Job Description


	Stanbic IBTC is positioned to continue to build capacity and create a sustainable talent pipeline within the organization.
	The organization is running a recruitment exercise for Relationship Managers to manage its existing portfolio of clients, while onboarding new clients/businesses.


Qualifications


	First degree in any field.
	Minimum of 3 - 6 years of experience
	Cognate experience in sales and relationship management of customers to be able to drive profitability and build relationships
	Experience within the financial industry with experience in managing small businesses.


Additional Information
Behavioural Competencies:


	Generating Ideas
	Developing Strategies
	Interpreting Data
	Convincing People
	Team Working


Technical Competencies:


	Customer Understanding
	Product Knowledge
	Application and Submission Verification
	Account opening and maintenance
	Product Related Systems.


Note:&nbsp;Please send in your application if you have any knowledge of or interests in managing relationships and if you meet all the criteria required for this role.",

Banker, Business Job at Stanbic IBTC Bank




        
    

        
        Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa's financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Banker, Business
     

            
    



Job Ref ID:80438460A-0001
Job Location: Ota, Sango Over Bridge, Ogun
Employment Type: Full Time
Business Segment: Business & Commercial Banking.

Job Description


	Stanbic IBTC is positioned to continue to build capacity and create a sustainable talent pipeline within the organization.
	The organization is running a recruitment exercise for Relationship Managers to manage its existing portfolio of clients, while onboarding new clients/businesses.


Qualifications


	First degree in any field.
	Minimum of 3 - 6 years of experience
	Cognate experience in sales and relationship management of customers to be able to drive profitability and build relationships
	Experience within the financial industry with experience in managing small businesses.


Additional Information
Behavioural Competencies:


	Generating Ideas
	Developing Strategies
	Interpreting Data
	Convincing People
	Team Working


Technical Competencies:


	Customer Understanding
	Product Knowledge
	Application and Submission Verification
	Account opening and maintenance
	Product Related Systems.


Note: Please send in your application if you have any knowledge of or interests in managing relationships and if you meet all the criteria required for this role.
